Michihiro Yasunaga

I am a 3rd-year undergraduate student in computer science at Yale University. I research natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML), advised by Prof. Dragomir Radev (@ LILY lab) and Prof. John Lafferty.

My research aims to develop machine learning methods for natural language understanding, such as summarization (YZMPSR'17), coreference resolution (ZSYXR'18), semantic parsing, and mathematical text modeling. I am also interested in the robustness and interpretability of machine learning techniques (especially of neural networks) in NLP (YKR'18).

I co-organize a workshop on scientific document summarization at SIGIR 2018.

Other Projects

  • Named Entity Recognition for Academic Advising
    Recognizing and linking academic named entities to university database. Part of the Conversational Technologies Project with University of Michigan and IBM Research.
